agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency

OPM sends a second test email from its new government-wide email system to all government employees

Two anonymous federal employees file a class action lawsuit against OPM for launching the new email system without conducting a Privacy Impact Assessment for the new system
OPM named as defendant in new lawsuit Jane Does 1-2 v. Office of Personnel Management (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00234)
A DOGE official first arrives at USAID. Later, senior staff are summoned to a meeting with Gavin Kliger and Luke Farritor.
According to his sworn testimony, Adam Ramada started working at the Department of Education on this date. He says there is one other USDS staffer with him, two other detailees and two DOE staffers.
Two DOGE staffers attempted to force water pumps to be turned on in a large reservoir in California for a photo op
OPM sends out the "Fork in the Road" email to all federal employees offering them a chance to resign
Jeremy Lewin starts working at USAID as both a Senior Advisor and Director for Strategy & Programs
A ticket for systems access is issued to give Marko Elez read-only access to the FROPK and SPR systems and read-write access to PAM
A ticket for systems access is corrected to note that Marko Elez should only have read-only access to the PAM system

named: Leland Dudek, Mike Russo, Scott Coulter
event: Leland Dudek reaches out to Tiffany Flick, the Associate Director of Budget, Facilities and Security to inform her two DOGE staff would be onboarding. He was a mid-level employee at the time.
DOGE discovers that some USAID grants had been paid automatically through HHS despite a declared freeze
Farritor and Kliger demanded that all senior managers be stripped of their power to authorize payments - and that they alone become the authorizers.
A ticket for systems access is corrected to change Marko Elez's access from read-only to read-write
Federal employees at OPM are locked out of access to key systems by DOGE and OPM leadership
Mike Russo begins onboarding as new CIO, introduces himself as a DOGE representative to staff
Another ticket is filed to remove write access from Marko Elez's profile in the PAM system

USAID Director of Security and deputy placed on administrative leave for trying to prevent DOGE from accessing personnel files and classified data
USAID website and 6 other related websites are taken offline by DOGE
Approximately 2000 USAID email accounts are deactivated
Elon Musk posts a series of tweets calling USAID evil and saying it is "time for it to die"

Twenty DOGE staff are in the agency and "have gained access to multiple sensitive internal systems, the people said, including a financial aid dataset that contains the personal information for millions of students enrolled in the federal student aid program."

Elon Musk tweets that he and President Trump are shutting down USAID, bragging he had fed the agency "into the wood chipper"
DOL staff reportedly ordered "to give DOGE access to whatever they ask for-or risk termination"

Gauiter "Cole" Killian appears in an EPA internal directory as a "Federal Detailee"

Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly rules that DOGE should only be granted read access to government systems
A ticket is updated to note Marko Elez's account remote access via SSH to a DB2 database has been revoked

Marko Elez resigns allegedly after past racist tweets are revealed (but also same day as being discovered with write access)
DOGE member and lawyer Jacob Altik joins the case for the defense
The court dismisses the motion for a temporary restraining order against the OPM email system since there is now a PIA

Ryan Riedel, a SpaceX network security engineer with 4 years of experience, is named the CIO for the agency

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency

CNN reporter shares that a FOIA request about DOGE was replied to with "they just fired the whole privacy team"

"His duties currently relate to improper payments and SSA's Death Master File."
According to a sworn declaration, "SSA began onboarding and training Employee 5, an engineer, detailed from the United States DOGE Service to SSA" with an inter-agency agreement to DOGE.

According to a sworn declaration, SSA "began onboarding and training Employee 2, Senior Advisor (Program Specialist AD-0301-00). He is in the process of being detailed from National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) to SSA."
Senate Democrats send letter to VA Secretary demanding information about DOGE's activities there

event: Staff at the CDC CIO's office report not being contacted by DOGE yet
Edward Coristine and Kyle Schutt are given access to CISA systems
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says only one person from DOGE is "looking at an outdated IT system, that's all they're doing."
Thomas Shedd has allegedly requested admin access to 19 different systems within TTS at GSA

Trump issues an Executive Order "Commencing the Reduction of the Federal Bureaucracy" targeting the Presidio Trust, the Inter-American Foundation, the United States African Development Foundation and the United States Institute of Peace for reductions.

According to one agency employee, DOGE workers already have access to contracts, partnerships, performance reviews, classified national-security information, and satellite data, among other materials.
According to a sworn declaration, "Employee 10, a software engineer, was detailed from the Office of the Administrator at the General Services Administration to SSA" (possibly Ehtan Shaotran)

Trump issues an Executive Order "Commencing the Reduction of the Federal Bureaucracy" targeting the Presidio Trust, the Inter-American Foundation, the United States African Development Foundation and the United States Institute of Peace for reductions.
USADF board member Ward Brehm becomes aware that his agency is going to be targeted by DOGE for elimination

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Trump issues an executive order "Ending Taxpayer Subsidization of Open Borders" that instructs USDS to work with agencies to identify federal funding for immigrants and build up eligibility verification systems

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Trump issues an executive order "Ensuring Lawful Governance and Implementing the President's Department of Government Efficiency Deregulatory Initiative" which requires agency heads to consult with DOGE teams on deregulatory efforts.

Trump issues an Executive Order "Commencing the Reduction of the Federal Bureaucracy" targeting the Presidio Trust, the Inter-American Foundation, the United States African Development Foundation and the United States Institute of Peace for reductions.
Division leaders at the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency informed some senior CISA staffers that DOGE has access to internal emails and Microsoft Teams chats of employees.

named: Leland Dudek, Ethan Shaotran, Nikhil Rajpal, Cole Killian, Marko Elez

The Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the IRS and DOGE is signed, will not let DOGE access individual tax returns

named: Ethan Shaotran, Jacob Altik, Nate Cavanaugh

The MOU for DOGE's IT Modernization is between USADF and GSA and only covers the activities of Ethan Shaotran

named: Ethan Shaotran, Jacob Altik, Nate Cavanaugh
event: Once MOU is signed, DOGE staff reveal their real purpose is to conduct a massive reduction in agency staff and scope and demand to file a RIF plan by 2/24

Nate Canaugh and Jacob Altik then demanded immediate access to USADF systems including financial records and payment and human resources systems. They were told they had to go through standard clearance process.
Jacob Altik demands waivers to exempt DOGE staff from background checks, threatens to fire USADF board if demands are not materials.
USADF general cousel revokes their participation in the MOU based on it being under false pretenses

Sara Aviel is dismissed as the CEO of the IAF

In a ruling, a judge declared "DOGE affiliates have been granted access to systems of record that contain some of the plaintiffs' most sensitive data - Social Security numbers, dates of birth, home addresses, income and assets, citizenship status, and disability status - and their access to this trove of personal information is ongoing"
A court ruling names the systems NSLDS, COD, FAS and FMS as being accessed by DOGE

named: Luke Farritor, Rachel Riley, Jeremy Lewin, Clark Minor
event: Reports that DOGE have accounts are working with the NIH Business System Department for NIH's central electronic business system, which includes finance, budget, procurement, a property-management system, and a grant-tracking system

After Elon Musk threatens on X that employees must complete a list of 5 accomplishments and send it to OPM or risk termination, OPM sends out an email requesting that list (without the threat) to every government employee. Widespread confusion occurs at many agenices.
USADF president/CEO Ward Brehm receives an email from Trent Morse in the White House Personnel Office notifying him that he is removed from tbe board.

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In a hearing for "Alliance for Retired Americans v. Bessent," Judge Kollar-Kotelly repeatedly grills DOJ lawyers on who the USDS Administrator is

named: James Burnham, Jacob Altik, Nate Cavanaugh

named: James Burnham, Jacob Altik, Nate Cavanaugh

The Post reports that DOGE is being granted access to only anonymized data from IDRS

Republican lawmakers on the U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security unanimously opposed a resolution of inquiry into DOGE activities at DHS

Without any warning, GSA puts a $1 spending limit on all government purchase cards following an executive order by Trump. This predictably creates a large amount of chaos by destroying the ability of agencies to do micro-purchases allowed by law.

Wired reports that DOGE staff were given read-only access to some systems and read-write access to payment systems within HUD as well as the centralized authorization system that grants access to other systems (date unknown)
According to a sworn declaration, "employee 8, an engineer, was detailed from Office of Personnel Management to SSA. His duties currently relate to improper payments and death data."

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: Trump issues an executive order mandating that DOGE teams will have approval over awarding any contract at any agency and freezes purchase cards for 90 days

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: After days of sustained questioning about who the USDS Administrator is, the White House gives the name of Amy Gleason. It is unclear how long she had been in the role.
Thomas Shedd, an engineer who has worked 8 years at Tesla, is named the head of GSA's Technology Transformation Services (TTS)
According to a sworn declaration, "Employees 4, 6, and 9 were each appointed as an expert, special government employee"

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: U.S. District Judge John Bates orders that some DOGE officials should be required to testify under oath
Peter Marocco arrives at IAF after most staff had left, holds an impromptu board meeting with himself only, declares himself President/CEO of IAF

Gavin Kliger and Sam Corcos, DOGE representatives embedded at the tax agency, on Friday asked IRS lawyers to assist in creating an "omnibus" agreement with other federal agencies that would allow a broad swath of federal officials to cross-reference benefits rolls with taxpayer data
OPM amends the Privacy Impact Assessment for its Government-Wide Email System (GWES) to remove declarations that responses are voluntary.

USADF Managing Director of Finance Mathieu Zahui receives an email from Trent Morse informing him the USADF is "boardless" and naming Peter Marocco as acting chair. Zahui informs them appointment would require senate confirmation first.
TTS administrator Thomas Shedd eliminates 90 members of 18F with a 1am firing email and locks them out of their machines

In an email to staff, Dudek explains the disruptions by saying "elections have consequences"
DOI named as defendant in new lawsuit Center for Biological Diversity v. U.S. Department of Interior (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00612)

DOGE staff attempt to access "a system within a broader government database created to help enforce child support payments, which pulls a vast trove of information, including income data linked to nearly all workers"
The head of HR, Traci DiMartini, is placed on administrative leave for refusing to bring in employees over the weekend to onboard Sam Corcos
USADF board member Ward Brehm is elected by the board as President/CEO of USADF
DOGE boasts in a tweet that 27% more water was released in February compared to January (unclear if this adjusts for different lengths of months)
FEMA named as defendant in new lawsuit Comans v. Department of Homeland Security (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00624)

named: Kyle Schutt, Nate Cavanaugh, Edward Coristine, Ethan Shaotran, Luke Farritor, Derek Geissler, Nicole Hollander
event: Wired reports that some DOGE staff (Kyle Schutt, Nate Cavanaugh) are being paid in the GSA, but others are listed as volunteers for that agency

Brad Smith is formally onboarded at HHS as a Senior Advisor and swears the oath of office
Peter Marocco announces himself to staff as President/CEO, begins dismantling all contracts, places all staff on administrative leave for 30 days
DOGE brags on its X account that the IAF has been reduced to a single employee

In a meeting, Dudek stresses again that DOGE will make mistakes and also admits "I am receiving decisions that are made without my input. I have to effectuate those decisions," suggesting DOGE is in charge.

Jordan Wick is formally onboarded as an employee of the CFPB (and not a DOGE detailee) and swears the Oath of Office

named: Marko Elez, Aram Moghaddassi, Miles Collins
event: Business Insider reports Marko Elez, Aram Moghaddassi, and Miles B. Collins are new DOGE arrivals at Department of Labor
According to a sworn declaration, "the agency began onboarding Employee 7, as a detailee from Department of Labor (DOL) to SSA."
Nate Cavanaugh sends Ward Brehm an email demanding to know by what authority he is the President/CFO of USADF
Jacob Altik and Ethan Shaotran are rebuffed by agency leadership when attempting to enter the agency

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: From this date, detailing arrangements for DOGE staff are between the target agency and other agencies hiring DOGE staff, according to a declaration made by DOGE in AFL-CIO et al vs. Department of Labor

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit Japanese American Citizens League v. Musk (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00643)
Complying with the Executive Order from 2/19, USIP submits a letter to OMB asserting that USIP is an independent nonprofit organization, not a federal agency
Thomas Shedd says in a statement that he expects TTS will be 50% smaller within weeks

named: Jacob Altik, Ethan Shaotran, Nate Cavanaugh
event: DOGE staff Jacob Altik and Ethan Shaotran return joined by Nate Cavanaugh with US marshals to force entry to the agency
USADF named as defendant in new lawsuit Brehm v. Marocco (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00660)
Education named as defendant in new lawsuit Democracy Forward Foundation v. U.S. Department of the Treasury (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00684)
Ryan Reiedel resigns from the CIO role and departs from the agency
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit Centro de Trabajadores Unidos v. Bessent (D.D.C) (Case No 1:25-cv-00677)
Treasury named as defendant in new lawsuit Democracy Forward Foundation v. U.S. Department of the Treasury (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00684)
DOGE rolls out a custom GSAi custom chatbot to 1500 workers
SBA named as defendant in new lawsuit Democracy Forward Foundation v. U.S. Department of the Treasury (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00684)
DOGE staff are granted access to NDNH and objecting federal staff are "no longer with the agency"
USIP President George Moose becomes aware that DOGE is conducting some sort of reconnaisance with respect to USIP's security operations and contractor
The Trump Administration nominates Kenneth Jackson and Russell Vought to be on the board of the IAF
Trump admin nominates Laken Rapier and Russell Vought to be on the board of the USADF

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: U.S. District Judge Christopher Cooper demands a rolling production of DOGE to produce documents in discovery within weeks
New CIO Antoine McCord arrives at DHS, reportedly with affiliates of DOGE
Elon Musk visits the NSA to meet with its top administrator, General Timothy Haugh

In a sworn declaration, Florence Felix-Lawson notes "the SSA DOGE Team currently consists of ten SSA employees: four SSA special government employees (Employees 1, 4, 6, and 9) and six detailees to SSA from other government agencies and offices (Employees 2, 3, 5, 7, 8, and 10)"
Multiple SSA employees told ProPublica, their tech systems seem to be crashing nearly every day, leading to more delays in serving beneficiaries.

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: US District Judge Tanya Chutkan issues an order giving DOGE and Elon Musk three weeks to comply with document discovery requests about its staffing and downsizing plans for agencies
Education named as defendant in new lawsuit State of New York v. McMahon (D.Mass) (Case No 1:25-cv-10601)
Ross Graeber is named the new CIO of the Department of Energy, after working with DOGE at the Department of State

named: Edward Coristine, Marko Elez, Luke Farritor, Aram Moghaddassi, Rachel Riley
event: As later reported in a declaration in AFL-CIO et al. vs. Department of Labor, HHS employee Mark Samburg finds DOGE staff at the agency listed in an online directory as Executive Engineers (and Rachel Riley as a Senior Advisor)
The acting chief counsel of the IRS, William Paul, is removed from his role and replaced by Andrew De Mello, who is seen as more supportive of DOGE's work at the agency

named: Akash Bobba, Scott Coulter, Marko Elez, Luke Farritor, Antonio Gracias, Cole Killian, Jon Koval, Nikhil Rajpal, Payton Rehling, Ethan Shaotran
event: Wired reports that 10 DOGE staffer - Akash Bobba, Scott Coulter, Marko Elez, Luke Farritor, Antonio Gracias, Gautier Cole Killian, Jon Koval, Nikhil Rajpal, Payton Rehling, and Ethan Shaotran - are showing up in the Microsoft Teams directory at SSA
Postmaster General Louid DeJoy sends a letter to Congress informing he has signed an agreement with GSA and DOGE to eliminate 10,000 jobs
Thomas Shedd apparently starts working at the CIO at Department of Labor while also serving as the TTS Commissioner at GSA (experts are unclear if this is legal)

agency: Institute for Museum and Library Services
event: Trump issues a new executive order proclaiming that the IMLS among other agencies must be reduced to statutory functions only
ProPublica reports that Scott Coulter has "wide access to internal databases at NASA"

named: Alexander Simonpour, Riley Sennott, Scott Coulter
event: A Business Insider article reports that Alexander Simonpour has shown up at NASA and also has a GSA address. Riley Sennott and Scott Coulter also are listed
Various members of the USIP board report receiving emails from the White House saying they are terminated from their positions.

named: Kenneth Jackson, Jacob Altik, Nate Cavanaugh
event: DOGE members Kenneth Jackson, Jacob Altik and Nate Cavanaugh show up at USIP building with 2 other people claiming to be FBI agents and are refused entry. They attempted to present a document firing the USIP president.
Two FBI agents visited a senior USIP security official at his home unannounced to ask about gaining entry to the building, possibly through pressuring the the Institute's security contractor

Chief of the Criminal Division of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of Columbia, Johnathan Hornok, and two FBI special agents called USIP's outside counsel, Mr. Foote, stating that they had suspicion of criminal behavior at USIP,
Concerned they might be coerced by DOGE, the Chief Security Officer suspends the contract for building security contractor Inter-Con after being contacted by FBI agents interested in questioning him
At 6pm, all Inter-Con staff are removed from the building, all keycard access is revoked and all physical keys accounted for except for one held by the Inter-Con account manager for USIP
At 2:30pm, the Inter-Con account manager and employees attempt to enter the building with key cards and are denied. They use the physical key to enter once the account manager arrives with it.
At 2:59pm, USIP Security Chief calls DC police and institutes a high-level lockdown for the building. He observes with the security cameras that DOGE staff attempting entry on various doors.
Asked why they are attempting to gain control of the building, the Vice President of Inter-Con reports that DOGE threatened to cancel every single one of their federal contracts if they didn't comply
USIP President George Moose reports being present when four Inter-Con employees entered the USIP building without permission
USIP President George Moose is escorted out of the building by DC police who entered with DOGE at 5:30pm

named: Kenneth Jackson, Jacob Altik, Nate Cavanaugh
event: DOGE members Kenneth Jackson, Jacob Altik and Nate Cavanaugh remove staff and president of the USIP with the help of Office of the U.S. Attorney for the District of Columbia, the FBI and D.C. police
Kenneth Jackson is named Acting President of the US Institute of Peace
Various USIP staff report receiving messages from DOGE staff asking for employee lists and access to computer systems
Keith Sonderling is sworn in as the Deputy Secretary of labor

A lawyer for the plaintiffs accuses the DOJ of misrepresenting Altik's participation "perhaps to preserve the illusion that OPM's counsel were ignorant of what OPM was doing with the Government-Wide Email System, or perhaps to obscure the role of DOGE and the White House in this case."
In a ruling in J. Doe 1-26 v. Musk (D. Md), Judge Theodore D. Chuang finds that the decision to shut down USAID violated the Constitution in multiple ways and orders the agency must be reopened

Jeremy Lewin is appointed to the position of Deputy Administrator (Policy and Programming) and Kenneth Jackson is named Deputy Administrator (Management and Resources). He claims it was unrelated to the ruling by Chuang.

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In an unsigned email response to the Intercept Media, DOGE claims it is within the Executive Office of the President and not subject to FOIA

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In a ruling in J. Doe 1-26 v. Musk (D. Md), Judge Theodore D. Chuang declares that evidence shows that Elon Musk was effectively running DOGE without being appointed to the role
USIP named as defendant in new lawsuit United States Institute of Peace v. Jackson (D.D.C.) (Case No 1:25-cv-00804)
GSA hosts a deep-background media briefing to demo its GSAi tool with invitations sent to reporters from Bloomberg, The Atlantic, and Fox among others.

agency: Institute for Museum and Library Services
event: IMLS staff learn that DOGE is planning to visit the following day; most make plans to attend

named: Peter Marocco, Jeremy Lewin, Kenneth Jackson
event: Peter Marocco says that he will be succeeded at the agency by Jeremy Lewin and Kenneth Jackson

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In another sworn statement, Amy Gleason declares "every member of an agency's DOGE Team is an employee of the agency or a detailee to the agency." She does clarify that some are detailed from USDS but also claims they report to agency heads.

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In a sworn statement, Jeremy Lewin declares he has never been an employee of USDS or Elon Musk but reports he was the DOGE team lead at USAID for a while
DOGE-affiliated staff start removing interior signage from the USIP building
Judge Beryl Howell presides over an emergency hearing on granting USIP's request for a temporary restraining order against DOGE, but doesn't grant a temporary restraining order

Trump issues an executive order which explicitly includes an instruction that "the Secretary of Labor and the Secretary's designees shall receive, to the maximum extent consistent with law, unfettered access to all unemployment data and related payment records, including all such data and records currently available to the Department of Labor's Office of Inspector General."

agency: Institute for Museum and Library Services
event: DOGE arrives at IMLS HQ, are startled to find staff there, swear in Keith Sonderling as acting director and leave
Access to purchase cards are restored at NIH for nonemergency purchases, but scientists face a huge backlog in processing orders for supplies.
President Trump issues an executive order that requests OPM to redefine regulations to give them more power to terminate employees at other agencies

In a ruling for AFL-CIO vs. SSA, Judge Hollander grants a temporary restraining order enjoining DOGE from having any access to SSA systems or installing any software as well as ordering them to delete any data
Leland Dudek threatens to shut down the entire Social Security Administration instead of complying with the order

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: In a response to the court order by Judge Cooper in CREW v. DOGE, the government estimates it would need to produce 105,403 documents in discovery

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: President Trump issues an executive order demaning that agency heads must share all access to any unclassified datasets "related to the identification and elimination of waste, fraud, and abuse" but also "to the maximum extent consistent with law"
USIP website is taken offline
Elon Musk arrives at the Pentagon for a meeting with leadership, reportedly to discuss DOGE
DOGE expands the GSAi chatbot rollout to more than 13,000 GSA employees

Ruling in American Federation of Teachers et al v. Bessent et al, Judge Boardman issues a preliminary injunction against to internal systems at the Departoment of Education by DOGE staff and the Acting Secretary where the justification for access was "the DOGE agenda" (i.e., all of them)

Ruling in American Federation of Teachers et al v. Bessent et al, Judge Boardman issues a preliminary injunction against DOGE access to internal systems at the Departoment of the Treasury where the justification for access was "the DOGE agenda" (i.e., all of them)

named: Charles Ezell, Amanda Scales, Greg Hogan
event: Ruling in American Federation of Teachers et al v. Bessent et al, Judge Boardman issues a preliminary injunction against access to internal systems at OPM by DOGE staff, but still allows it for OPM leadership including Ezell, Scales and Hogan

In a status update, SSA leadership confirms "SSA has revoked all SSA DOGE Team members' access to SSA systems of records, including but not limited to the Enterprise Data Warehouse, Numident, Master Beneficiary Record, and Supplemental Security Record"

agency: US Digital Service/Department of Government Efficiency
event: USDS/DOGE named as defendant in new lawsuit The Intercept Media, Inc. v. United States Department of Government Efficiency (S.D.N.Y.) (Case No 1:25-cv-02404)

During his confirmation hearing, Frank Bisignano, the nominee to run the agency, confirms that he had coordinated with Michael Russo but denied a whistleblower report that he had ordered the appointment of DOGE staff there
